name: Le Meridien Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, superb facilities, spotlessly clean, excellent staff. A perfect hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: For visiting Brussels, this is one of the best located hotels. 100 meter walk to city center and directly across from the Central Train Station. We used this as headquarters to hop on the train to Brugge and Ghent and to explore the Brussels center. You can get on the train at the airport and be at Central Station in 10 min; walk across the street to the Meridien and take a shower and be downtown within 20 min. Perfect location.
reviews.title: Great Location
Good Location, good hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business. It was a pleasant surprise arriving at 9AM and having a room ready (most of the times in European hotels I have to wait until after 12 noon to get a room after arriving early morning from the US). Overall the hotel is very nice - main lobby area is roomy, the rooms themselves well-kept. Maybe i was in a newly renovated room, but I didn't think it was old or tired. My biggest complaint, if any, would be the breakfast. Thankfully I had it included in my room rate - but almost 30 Euros for a middle-of-the-road hotel buffet is pretty crazy. I'd stay here again if i was coming back to Brussels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is truly 5 stars across the board. We were upgraded to the one bedroom suite. The room was stunning with great LCDs in each room, a plush and comfortable bed, amazing views of Brussels, and a luxurious marble bathroom! The staff is super friendly and helpful. Not only did they upgrade our room, they gave us a bottle of champagne and chocolates! I wished we stayed here one more night. I didn't want to leave. Truly a fantastic and amazing hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Brussels for just one night and had a great experience. We got to the hotel around 11am and our room was ready and they had upgraded us to a much larger room for free. We knew nothing about the city but you literally walk out around the back of the hotel and you are in the middle of it all. For a short trip to see the Grand Place and Manneken Pis and to eat some waffles and mussels you can't beat the location of Le Meridien.
reviews.title: Great location for sightseeing

reviews.text: Right across the train station and just behind Grand Place. This is a perfect location for easy access to trams and busses to get around the city. The rooms are just plain old. Needs renovation for sure. Very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Needs renovation. Perfect location.

reviews.text: Typically don't stay by the tourist traps in Brussels, prefer Ixelles etc, but the price was right (C$159 via Expedia versus extortionate rack rate of €450) + needed to catch train to airport early in the morning.
reviews.title: Very convenient, but only worth special rate deal

reviews.text: The convenience is fantastic, literally a 30 second walk to the Gare Central, and it's less than 5 minutes to the Grand Place etc. However rooms are quite small, ready for a reno, and the wi-fi didn't work in the room, and wasn't much better in the lobby. The bed was incredibly comfortable
reviews.title: Clean, convenient and service-oriented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is unbeatable and the rooms are well designed. Often hotel rooms have awkward spaces and poor ergonomics. Brussels is a city for art and design and the room reflected that attention to detail. The high water pressure made for the best shower I've ever had in a hotel. My service experience was top notch as well. The fitness center was well equiped and spotless. It was a rare pleasure to stay at such a well run hotel. I will return.
reviews.title: Great location near Central Station but rooms need updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Le Meridien Brussels for 2 nights in a standard room and would recommend this hotel mainly due its great central location in front of the Central Station. Thanks to this we were able to stay in Brussels (the hotel has a great weekend rate) and travel to other cities for day trips, which turned out to be a great idea for a city-break. It’s also within a walking distance from major attractions in Brussels, e.g. 5-10 min walk to Grand Place and 10 min walk to the Royal Museum of Fine Art. We didn’t have breakfast included so can’t comment, but there are few nice little cafes within 5 minute walk from hotel (towards Grand Place) where you can have breakfast for approx. 10 Euro. The hotel itself is comfortable, our room was spacious and clean but definitely in need of TLC and showing a lot of signs of tear & wear. The staff at check-in and concierge etc were all very professional, pleasant and accommodating. We had a lovely stay in this hotel, my rating would be much higher if it wasn’t for the old and tired-looking interiors, especially some rooms and corridors.
reviews.title: Comfortable room, great location

reviews.text: Stayed there 3 nights because of business trip. The location is great, you are directly in the city center. I think that the building needs renovation, but it was ok. The room was big enough, the bathroom as well but I dont like plastic curtain. Regarding breakfast, the buffet could be richer. Lunch buffet was ok, the food was really tasty. The meeting room was nice, spacious and had a big windows. I like natural during the meeting.
reviews.title: Great location, but it is not 5 star

reviews.text: We visited Brussels on a trip that started there and ended in Amsterdam. We took the train from the airport after an overnight flight and arrived early in the morning. The Hotel is right across a cobblestone square/circle from the central station. It is a thirty second walk. I knew it would be close and chose it for that reason. My worry was about security and safety as this is usually not a good choice in most cases. I was pleasantly greated by the front desk and concierge and we were given a free coupon for a visit to a local art museum and map of the area. We checked our bags with the concierge and it all couldn't have gone smoother. I was very pleased to learn later when we got our room keys that a key was needed to use the elevators and the lobby remained well lit and fully staffed all night. The room was equipped with anything we would need and we were happy but I will say that the rooms were run down some and could use a reno. I believe they will get there as they were working on the public spaces at the time of our stay so if they are smart they won't stop there. Not really a 5* but surely could easily be. We would love to stay again next time as we felt very comfortable there.
reviews.title: Great location nice staff
Pls don't charge for wifi
reviews.text: Great location for a 5 star hotel but really bad n service specially to be charged for wifi in those days u can get free in any coffee shop

Great Location if you are staying in Brussels, the booking was in my partners name, and we arrived seperately (he was working in brussels i came out for the weekend) the receptionist informed me that normally i wouldnt be able to check in (even though i had the confirmation reservation) as it wasnt booked in my name and i didnt have the credit card.....this is probably true but after 5 minutes of huffing and puffing i was allowed the room, the receptionist was quite friendly and did let me checkin 2 hours early ;-)! only disappointment was the bags, there was staff milling around in the reception area but nobody offered to help with my bags...insted watching people struggle through the doors with their luggage. Parts of the hotel is currently being renovated (Bar area) but this did not affect us as we didnt spend much time in the hotel. Reception staff also didnt offer any tourist information or a map of the city which would have been helpful (even though i had been a few times before, it would have been nice to be asked if i needed any details)
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a pleasant stay, we have been to this hotel twice and would defintely come again ;-)
reviews.title: NICE LOCATION, OKAY HOTEL, BAD STAFF

reviews.text: "Needs Renovation"???????
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again.
excellent location
reviews.text: I don't think E McKelly stayed at the same Le Meridien Brussels as I did. My friend and I just got back from an Easter weekend stay there and this hotel certainly does not need renovating.

Our rooms were very modern, comfortable and nicely furnished. The bathroom was clean bright and spacious. The public spaces were fine. The only downside for us was the lack of air conditioning in the corridors and rooms. It did get a little stuffy at times.
reviews.title: Sleep here!

reviews.text: I can highly recommend the day trip to Ghent and Bruges that we organised through the concierge - 42 Euros for a full day. There's a leaflet on the concierge desk detailing this.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Location wise I don't think there's anywhere more convenient in Brussels. It's right across the road from Brussels Central station which is just 15 mins and 2.80 Euros from the airport. It's also just 5 mins to the Grande Place and Rue des Bouchers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great staff
Will be going back for sure
reviews.text: My husband took me to brussels for a long weekend as I have been unwell. He picked this hotel after reading the reveiws on this web site. I can't praise Le Meridien enough. The staff were so helpfull and friendly. Our room was lovely, clean smart and cool (hotter than the sun outside). Our bathroom was roomy smart and clean with both a bath and a large corner shower, this is the first hotel I have ever stayed in with a proper hairdryer (very important to me). The hotel had a gorgeous lobby and the bar meals were both fantastic and good value. My one criticism would be, stay well away from breakfast, the buffet breakfast is so expensive and the room service breakfast was more than dissapointing, but this was our own choice and we should have known to go outside to one of the lovely cafes for breakfast. The hotel is in a great location, very central and opposite the main station. We will be returning for sure when we next visit Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here two non-consectutive nights at the beginning and end of a trip in Belgium. Got a good weekend rate including breakfast for my first night, but had to pay the business price for the other night. Hotel and rooms are clean, breakfast was ok, staff was very helpful. Unless you can get a special rate, the hotel is not worth the price except for one reason – it is located right across from the central train station. If that is important to you, this is the place to stay. The room for the first night was very noisy, the second very quiet. Ask for a corner room that faces the small park. The rooms facing any of the streets will likely be noisy.
reviews.title: Great location, Just OK Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located in the heart of the city next to everything and across from the central station. Nice lobby, very good concierge and front desk.
reviews.title: Great location, decent hotel overall

likes.disliked: — Lots of small and so small problems

reviews.text: As a premium Starwood member they very kindly upgraded to me to junior suite 647 on the top floor. Large roof windows with a nice view and decent size (did not really feel like a junior suite). The room and the floor hallways had a somewhat worn feel that could use some work. Wearing carpets, knicks and untidy wallpaper and a strange mixture of interior design from floral to dark woods and black plasticy night and TV table.
reviews.title: This place is fabulous and so close to everything!

reviews.text: The main restaurant was closed for the summer without prior notice, room service advised at 17.45h that they would not open until an hour later, very small gym (although with five pieces of good equipment, just hope you are alone), no wireless in the room and internet wire not plugged in forcing me to move furniture and crawl on the floor. Nice bathroom although I would expect a larger tub in a junior suite. Decent bed although the mattress has seen better days.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Le Meridien over Christmas and New Years. The hotel is in an excellent location. It is only about a 5 minute walk to the incredible Grand Place. And you can do all the shopping you want by walking everywhere. But if you want to use the metro it is right across the plaza in the Central Station. We found the front desk staff and the concierges excellent. They were always willing to assist you with the smallest inquiry. The bar staff are also excellent. We bought a bottle of wine but did not have a cork screw and took it down to the bar and did not even have to ask to have them open it. They offered as soon as they saw the bottle. There are a lot of excellent restaurants in the vicinity. The rooms are a nice size. Very clean and quiet. The bathroom is very big. Lots of hot water. The only complaint, if you can even call it that, is the towels are a bit small and rough. The maid service is excellent. I cannot comment on the breakfast as we did not use it. The internet is not free and is pretty expensive. The bed is very comfortable as are the pillows. It is very easy to get to the hotel from the airport. The train arrives and departs from the Central Station. It costs 5.10 euros. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And
reviews.title: Room was fine. Service was spotty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ijo
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days over Christmas. We upgraded to a suite which was fine. We were disappointed in the service which was very spotty. Bar wait staff was not very good. Restaurant was closed some of the time. Breakfast was 58 Euros for 2 and it was skimpy. As noted by others, you can't beat the location (it is directly opposite the train station), but don't expect a lot for your money.
reviews.title: Good but nothing special

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for business but used it this time for leisure. Great location and situated across the road from gare central. Staff are very efficient and helpful but never used it to eat, drink or for breakfast (used Exki on the other side of Gallerie St Hubert for a healthy and great valure breakfast).
reviews.title: Worse experience

reviews.text: This hotel offers the best confluence of Bruxelles transportation options, centraal-ness, and comfort...stayed here for four nights last summer and was glad I did. Staff was friendly and helpful, the room was very good. A smart choice for a stay in the capital.
reviews.title: Location, Views, and Train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at Le Meridien in Brussels. Our room on the top floor was amazing, with big tilted ceiling windows that you could open up for fresh air and to let in sounds of the street performers at the train station that's right across the square. The staff was attentive. The room was clean and big. The location was great -- convenient to get to just about anything on foot! What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Location

reviews.text: The most comfortable hotel bed yet! Highly recommended
reviews.title: Very comfortable and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I decided to spend three nights here last November and it was a perfect stay. First, this hotel is very easy to get to, facing the Central Station in Brussels and it is also very conveniently located 2 minutes from the Grande Place and veeeery good gauffres places.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.text: The check-in was quick and we were actually upgrade to a suite on the top floor with the view to the Town Hall. The room was beautifully decorated and very romantic. We had belgian "speculos" biscuits waiting for us in the room and a welcome letter which was a very nice touch just at the beggining of our stay. The suite was big with a very confortable bed and the bathroom was just perfection with a big shower and a bathtub.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: This is by far the nicest European hotel I've stayed in! I had a standard room on a nonsmoking floor overlooking the front of the hotel. Elegant furnishings, huge closet, soft and cozy bathrobes and a huge bathroom with a full bathtub (not just a small standup shower).
reviews.title: Nicest European hotel I've stayed in!

reviews.text: I had booked with Priceline months in advance for 65 USD on a weekend night. Reception staff were friendly and even asked if I would like the Starwood points. Brussels was our first stop and we arrived by 10 AM on an overnight flight. I had faxed the hotel ahead of time to ask for early check in or luggage storage and we were wisked right up to our rooms. Elevators are secured in that you need your room key to call them from the lobby.
reviews.title: Great location, nothing fancy

reviews.text: The location of the hotel cannot be beat--it's right out of the door from the the main train station. Unlike many areas around train stations, this area is well maintained and felt very safe. The main square with chocolate shops and restaurants is only two blocks away.
reviews.title: perfect stay

reviews.text: With great service, elegant rooms, and a superb location, Le Meridien cannot be beat in Brussels.
reviews.title: A location that can't be beat

reviews.text: We stayed in the Le Meridian Brussels for 6 nites in May 2006. Upon arriving at the hotel at 0930, we were told it would be about an hour for the room to be ready. Not surprising as check in is much later than that. We were very happy when they had it ready in 30 minutes-after long flight it was great to get to our own room. Room was small-as usual for Europe, very clean and in a great location. The check in/reception staff were friendly, but can't say the same for the rest of the staff. Housekeeping staff were cheerful and as far as I am concerned, were the best at their job as anyone we encountered. Dining room staff were efficient and concierge/ bell staff were ridiculous. They were not helpful with anything and our driver had to summon someone to come out to get our bags.
reviews.title: Lovely Le Meridian

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Meridien overnight and while the stay was pleasant enough, I was very disappointed that they were unable to locate a nightgown which I had left in the room. I contacted the hotel later in the check-out day to ask that they try to find the article. This was unsuccessful and housekeeping reported that although no one had occupied the room the next day, the article was no where to be found. Since this was not an expensive item or one of significant value, I was not distraught but dissapointed to find a 5* without better attention to forgotten items. We did enjoy the facility (great bathroom, helpful concierge, and great location) and we were able to book thru Priceline.
reviews.title: Minor glitch

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in April 2006 and had a wonderful experience. Booked an upper level double room and b/c are gold Starwood were upgraded to a lovely Junior Suite with view towards the Grande Place. Service was polite and courteous. Bell staff knew our names and had car ready to go and pulled up out front when we checked out without our having said a thing. The room had a very comfortable bed, a sitting area, and a very nice espresso/coffee machine (one with the Nescafe pre-made packets that you put in the machine to make whatever type of coffee you choose at the press of a button) - but not sure this is in non-suite rooms as friends of ours did not have one in their room. Bathroom with lovely shower and separate tub. Great water pressure. Returned late one night and wanted to sit in the lobby and chat. Bar was already closed but bartender still there; gave us two beers from draft on the house. This was a very thoughtful touch and highlights the great service that we had throughout our stay at Le Meridien. Although I have also stayed at the Hotel Amigo which is also excellent, the value, especially if you can get an upgrade, is better at the Meridien. You can't go wrong with choosing this hotel for your stay in Brussels. One final note - location is excellent, across the street from train station and few minutes walk from Grand Place. The neighborhood is clean and safe - the nearby trainstation is not at all a detractor. Make sure to eat a waffle and get some frites while walking around!
reviews.title: Meridien Madness!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for four days over Easter and while the location is super, the hotel is definately not five star standard. The first thing we noticed on our arrival was scaffolding in reception - apparently repairs were taking place. We were given a room upgrade & while the room was adequate - the decor was a little tired - and it certainly wouldn't have been worth the rack rate of €500. The buffet breakfast in the morning was ok, but nothing more. The room it was served in was tired and dated and was in need of a renovation. The staff on reception were fine but not particularly helpful - the concierge was away from his desk anytime we tried to speak to him.
reviews.title: Great Location, but definately not five star !

reviews.text: If the hotel had been a four star I would rate it as adequate but as a five star - with its lack of additional facilities - I would rate it as basic.
reviews.title: Would definitely go back again!

reviews.text: Stayed at Le Meridien over the Easter weekend...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Brilliant Location

reviews.text: Soulless Le Meridien. What you get is consumerised sterility. This hotel is just like every single other Le Meridien, not a hint of anything different. Negatives:Was checked into a room on the second floor which was the smoking floor. The room stank of stale smoke. Breakfast is completely overpriced at EUR30 and not worth it. I had better croissants down the road. Positives: Location, Location. The front door literally hits you when you walk out of Centraal Station. Yet the hotel is far away enough (across a concourse) not to be troubled by human traffic. Also free internet in the business centre. Rooms are overpriced for what they are. Hotel close to restaurant district (2min walk down a charming cobbled avenue).
reviews.title: Only good thing is location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Meridien is a lovely hotel in a fantastic central location. The Grand Place square is so close, as are many other tourist attractions. The fact that it is across the street from the train station is another bonus! Rooms was great and from desk staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are visiting Belgium for a few days, and want a Brussels base, I can't imagine a better hotel option. I had read it was close to Brussels Central train station, but never thought it would be thirty paces from the station entrance! The rooms are just what you need, not overly fancy but everything you want from a hotel. Spotlesly clean.
reviews.title: Perfect for the weekend trip to Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was delicious, if a bit pricey (29 euro pp).
reviews.title: Great, but expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's walking distance to Grand Place (4-5 minutes), and if like most people visiting Brussels, you intend to visit Bruges or Gent, you can roll out of bed and crawl to the station if necessary.
reviews.title: Go ahead. Treat yourself!
Great hotel in a terrific location - shame about cost of breakfast and wifi
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastically located directly opposite the central station and a few minutes from the Grand Place. The staff were helpful and knowledgable. Our room was large and very comfortable with a great bathroom with a separate shower. The only reason I haven't given it five stars is that at 26 euros breakfast is an outrageous price, and similarly in room wifi is 15 euro per day. We had breakfast in a nearby cafe so could avoid the cost of that in the hotel, but I did have to have an Internet connection and am continually frustrated at the determination of so many hotels to gouge their guests for in room wifi charges. Free wifi is available in the hotel lobby but that's not a perfect solution at any time, and especially not in this case as the lobby was in the middle of an extensive refurb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, i would recommend the hotel but beware high charges for breakfast and wifi
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is perfect in term of decor and services. In term of location? Depends on how you view it. For, I arrived Brussels from Paris, the train station isn't the same train station across from the hotel. But at least the metro can connect bridge the distance. As a first timer to Brussels, it did cause a little bit of confusion. But the hotel is located in a perfect spot in town. Very close to all main attractions. The concierge provided a lot of suggestions to me on what to do and where to go. I enjoyed my stay there. The room is very sizable and very clean.
reviews.title: Very Convenient Location

reviews.text: If you are looking for a convenient location for sightseeing than just book this hotel. There cannot be any other hotel more centrally located. I couldn't believe my eyes when I walked out of Grand Centraal station, the hotel was right there. This station has very easy access to Brussels Midi from where I needed to catch the train to Paris. I agree with some other reviews that it doesn't have 5 star appeal as other Le Meridian hotels in the world but overall the room was big enough, had a good view, clean and modern bathroom, very comfortable bed, front desk and concierge were very helpful. I was there on the weekend and the rate I paid was fantastic. Wifi didn't work in my room and 2 out of 3 computers in business center were not working. Lots of great restaurants close by! Again the location is perfect ! The breakfast buffet is priced very expensive but you can easily skip by walking out to Centraal or towards the Grand Place.
reviews.title: Great location, but not 5 star quality

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice now for business within the last year. To me, there is nothing special that stands out about this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes this is a great location...directly opposite the Central Train station and about 2/3 mins walk from the main square.
reviews.title: Good location but I wouldn't go back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However.....whilst I won't pretend I stay in a lot of 5 star hotels I've beeen in one or two in my time...this isn't one. The rooms are OK, clean, a bit noisy....but OK. The main public areas are pleasant and well presented, once of the beaten track the corridors etc start to show a level of 'tiredness'. The breakfast is hideously expensive....not even worth considering. The general impression is one of being underwhelmed....we got a good rate by booking late, had I paid the full rate I'd have been left feeling seriously short-changed.
reviews.title: Perfect for Brussels

reviews.text: All in all the the Novotel and Ibis are right next door, they're in a great location too!
reviews.title: Location - Location - Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i booked the Meridian through a travel site because of its central location- and a great price on the room. We were pleasantly surprised, easily one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in, with a nicely appointed room and very professional staff. We were only in Brussels for one night, so location was a major factor. The hotel is situated right on the edge of the historic area with the Grand Place, Mannekin Pis and other sites less than two minutes walk away. Plenty of places to eat (touristy and not) nearby as well.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Don't miss the park near Notre Dame du Sablon. It's surrounded by statues of the cities' guildsmen. You can make a nice loop down the hill from the hotel into the Grand Place, around to the Sablon and up through the Mont des Arts which sits alongside the Parc Bruxelles that will bring you right back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good room, good stay, not remarkable

description: Perfectly located in the heart of Brussels, around the corner from the Grand Place, Le Méridien Brussels unfolds a new perspective on the capital of Europe. This inspiring hotel reveals newly renovated spaces & rooms defined by contemporary designed furniture.
